abstract_summ: We find that the mortality levels predicted using newspapers obituaries outperforms forecasts based on past mortality according to several performance metrics, making obituaries a potentially powerful alternative source of information to deal with real-time tracking of infectious disease outbreaks.We report the results of using newspapers obituaries to nowcast the mortality levels observed in Italy during the COVID-19 outbreak between February 24, 2020 and April 15, 2020.The paper provides some initial evidence that daily mortality rates (for any cause) by municipality or province can be used as a statistically reliable predictor of looming COVID-19 crises.Here we show that relatively short and intense quarantine periods can also be very effective in flattening the infection curve and even killing the virus, but the likelihood of such outcomes are low.Here we show that relatively short and intense quarantine periods can also be very effective in flattening the infection curve and even killing the virus, but the likelihood of such outcomes are low.
title_summ: Using newspapers obituaries to nowcast daily mortality: evidence from the Italian COVID-19 hot-spotsA Simple Early Warning Signal for COVID-19Quantifying the effects of quarantine using an IBM SEIR model on scalefree networksQuantifying the effects of quarantine using an IBM SEIR model on scalefree networks
title_abstract_phrases: Using newspapers obituaries to nowcast daily mortality: evidence from the Italian COVID-19 hot-spotsReal-time tracking of infectious disease outbreaks helps policymakers to make timely data-driven decisions.We find that the mortality levels predicted using newspapers obituaries outperforms forecasts based on past mortality according to several performance metrics, making obituaries a potentially powerful alternative source of information to deal with real-time tracking of infectious disease outbreaks.Quantifying the effects of quarantine using an IBM SEIR model on scalefree networksThe COVID-19 pandemic led several countries to resort to social distancing, the only known way to slow down the spread of the virus and keep the health system under control.Quantifying the effects of quarantine using an IBM SEIR model on scalefree networksThe COVID-19 pandemic led several countries to resort to social distancing, the only known way to slow down the spread of the virus and keep the health system under control.We report the results of using newspapers obituaries to nowcast the mortality levels observed in Italy during the COVID-19 outbreak between February 24, 2020 and April 15, 2020.
